headline: Big banks find many 'reasons to be optimistic about 2025' as Trump 2.0 nears
summary: Executives from the country’s biggest banks sounded optimistic Tuesday as they assessed the impact of a new Trump administration, the state of the US economy in 2025, and more interest rate cuts expected from the Federal Reserve.

headline: The Stock Market Is Underestimating Geopolitical Chaos, Goldman Sachs CFO Says

headline: Goldman CEO says dealmaking could surpass 10-year averages in 2025
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon said on Tuesday that dealmaking in equities, mergers and acquisitions, could exceed 10-year averages next year.  In the weeks since Donald Trump's U.S. presidential election victory, bankers have become more bullish on deals.

headline: Goldman Sachs sees more larger-scale strategic deals in 2025
summary: Goldman Sachs expects "strategic" deals by companies to accelerate in 2025 including large-scale mergers and acquisitions, its finance chief said on Tuesday.  "The intensity of our client dialog is accelerating and there are aspects of the overall strategic activity which are becoming more pronounced," Chief Financial Officer Dennis Coleman said at the Goldman Sachs Financial Services conference in New York.  "There is certainly elevated confidence with CEOs and clients that there could be more by way of larger-scale transactions, more strategic activity that could take place," Coleman said.

"There is certainly elevated confidence with CEOs and clients that there could be more by way of larger-scale transactions, more strategic activity that could take place," Coleman said.
